We've got the problem here that eclipse is running unter linux AND solaris with
the same HOME-dir for each user.(ahh motif eclipse btw). It runs on each when
.eclipse in the home-dir is (re)moved before changing the platform. But if not,
following error log is returned:

Sorry, I am not getting a clear picture of this scenario. 
Could you please describe the setup, step by step? Thanks.

Closing as there is no reproduceable test case or scenario. If you still have 
problems, please re-open and provide more details. Thanks.

I am having the same error on just a linux box with no share.  I moved the
.eclipse dir out of the way and I am now working.  The only difference that
seems relevant is that there was a config.ini in the old .eclipse/configuration
directory that contained:

osgi.sharedConfiguration.area=file\:/usr/local/miro-client/configuration/

This directory exists, but is not writeable.  I don't know why this would come
back with a null URL, which is apparently what is happening in the configuration
parser.
I also notice this was created on Jul 20 of last year, and that the property
sharedConfiguration.area is not the same as the property that the configuration
parser is looking for.  Maybe that's it?

By the way - I set -data ~/.miro on my RCP startup. It uses that for some stuff,
but why does it create a ~/.eclipse too? Is this configurable? It's annoying.

Chris,

Your old config is messing things up. It points to a location where eclipse 
expects to find the configuration information, which is likely not there.

traces.message: No application id has been found.
